org.spongepowered.api.entity.living

Interface Living

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DataHolder, Entity, EntityState, Identifiable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Aerial, Ageable, Agent, Ambient, Animal, Aquatic, ArmorStand, Bat, Blaze, Boss, CaveSpider, Chicken, ComplexLiving, Cow, Creeper, EnderDragon, Enderman, Endermite, Ghast, Giant, Golem, Guardian, Horse, Human, IronGolem, MagmaCube, Monster, Mooshroom, Ocelot, Pig, Player, Rabbit, Sheep, Silverfish, Sittable, Skeleton, Slime, SnowGolem, Spider, Squid, Tameable, Villager, Witch, Wither, Wolf, Zombie, ZombiePigman

    public interface Living
extends Entity
    Represents an entity that is living, and therefor can be damaged.

    Living entities can have PotionEffects, breathing air under water, custom names, and become invisible.

    • Method Detail

      • damage

        void damage(double amount)
        Subtracts from the health by the given amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - The damage amount

      • getHealth

        double getHealth()
        Returns the health amount.

        The range of the health depends on the object on which this method is defined. For players in Minecraft, the nominal range is between 0 and 20, inclusive, but the range can be adjusted.

        Convention dictates that health does not follow below 0 but this convention may be broken.

        Returns:
        Health value

      • setHealth

        void setHealth(double health)
        Sets the health amount.

        The range of the health depends on the object on which this method is defined. For players in Minecraft, the nominal range is between 0 and 20, inclusive, but the range can be adjusted.

        Convention dictates that health does not follow below 0 but this convention may be broken.

        Parameters:
        health - The health to set to

      • getMaxHealth

        double getMaxHealth()
        Gets the current maximum health.

        The maximum health may or may not include all attribute increasing health points.

        Returns:
        This entities maximum health

      • setMaxHealth

        void setMaxHealth(double maxHealth)
        Sets the current maximum health.

        The maximum health set here may affect the attribute increasing health points. The base health should be minded that it may be lower than the total maximum health of this entity.

        Parameters:
        maxHealth - The maximum health for this entity

      • addPotionEffect

        void addPotionEffect(PotionEffect potionEffect,
                     boolean force)
        Adds a PotionEffect to this entity.

        If a conflicting PotionEffect already exists, this will not be applied unless force is specified.

        Parameters:
        potionEffect - The PotionEffect to add.
        force - Whether or not to forcibly add it.

      • addPotionEffects

        void addPotionEffects(java.util.Collection<PotionEffect> potionEffects,
                      boolean force)
        Adds a list of PotionEffects to this entity.

        If a conflicting PotionEffect already exists, this will not be applied unless force is specified.

        Parameters:
        potionEffects - The PotionEffects to add.
        force - Whether or not to forcibly add it.
